qas.question: What did the AEA name their last plane?
Who was the first to fly the Silver Dart?
What professional did Bell make sure was present during the first Silver Dart flight?
What business did Baldwin and McCurdy start after the AEA folded?
On what month and day did the Silver Dart take its first flight?

context: Their final aircraft design, the <a0_0>Silver Dart<a0_0/>, embodied all of the advancements found in the earlier machines. On <a4_0>February 23<a4_0/>, 1909, Bell was present as the Silver Dart flown by <a1_0>J.A.D. McCurdy<a1_0/> from the frozen ice of Bras d'Or, made the first aircraft flight in Canada. Bell had worried that the flight was too dangerous and had arranged for <a2_0>a doctor<a2_0/> to be on hand. With the successful flight, the AEA disbanded and the Silver Dart would revert to Baldwin and McCurdy who began the <a3_0>Canadian Aerodrome Company<a3_0/> and would later demonstrate the aircraft to the Canadian Army.
